alert.note: Alert for Escambia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 6:56PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Baldwin. Portions of northwest Florida, including the following county, Escambia. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 554 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms repeatedly moving slowly over the same locations. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen with more rain expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Robertsdale, Loxley, Stapleton, Molino, Summerdale, Silverhill, Gateswood, Tenile, Bay Springs, McKinnon, Barrineau Park, Rosinton, Elsanor, Steelwood, Vangordon, Pine Haven, Molino Crossroads, Cantonment, Barth and Pine Barren. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
